subject: More Miniatures
event: Just wanted to post a couple more of the lovely figures from Dark Sword Miniatures. These two are from the latest release in their Ice & Fire line -- a wildling warrior and a lady of the court. They were painted for me by Matt Verzani, and a splendid job he did. The wildling was sculpted by Jeff Grace, the court lady by Tom Meier. Both of them are available (unpainted, but there are many fine painters on the net who take commissions if you lack the skill yourself) at http://darkswordminiatures.com/

comments.article: The artistry is impressive but if I were a "court lady" forced to walk around with my boobs falling out of my nicely-rendered-but-gravity-defying dress, I'd be pissed.

Yeah, that thing needs either straps or several inches more dress at the top.

The wildling looks great, though.

Yeah...the boobs are a little awkward. I hope we see more boob-diversity in future sculpts!

Wildling looks great, though.

You have to remember that these ladies are from Westeros. If they showed less skin they would never make it. Just think of it like they are modeling their attire based on a certain blonde bombshell guilty of twincest and the goal is to see how little they can cover and still be considered covered.

All joking aside, the key here is most miniature companies cater to the traditional younger male gamer crowd and this is what sells. For those of us who are true fans it actually would be nice to see a larger variety of wardrobes. Maybe some of the courtesans who would have been seen in the Stark lands before half of them were killed off. ;-)

Showing skin is one thing, defying gravity is another. Did they have double sided tape in Westeros??

But it does look like she raided Cersei's closet!
I'm so glad I wasn't the first one to say that. :)

*sigh* Yes I eagerly await the day when a miniatures company makes some figures for straight women rather than adolescant boys.

The dress is very pretty otherwise; I'm a big fan of parti-colouring.

Yeah, I don't know if adolescent boys really are going to be more likely to buy and paint an expensive miniature if it has boobs, or if that's just the marketing belief. You'd think if it were there would be more boob on the book covers and more naked Dany.

Although the naked Dany kind of makes my guy friends uncomfortable once they realize they're looking at the statue of a naked 14 year old girl.
Maybe she's a follower of R'hllor and her dress is held up by spoooooky fire magic.
...but she also looks positively undernourished. I'm sure it's not because the maker wanted her to conform to a distinctly late 20th century ideal :P
comments.subject: The boobs are one thing...

comments.upictitle: Hey, wait, what's going on?: britta perry
comments.article: It's totally a nip slip waiting to happen.
LOL...a wardrobe malfunction of epic proportions.
Beautiful miniatures, and Verzani's a terrific painter. Thanks for sharing the images, George. Don't think I'd want to end up on the wrong side of the wildling's bone axe.
comments.subject: Re: great

comments.article:
True, I can't wait to read future books either...it's good to know I'm not the only one. (...why were some of the posts in this thread deleted? Is this blog censored?")

It'd be interesting to see what a grown up Sansa mini might look like. If the dress were more high cut I think this sculpt would work if it had blue and silver coloring with the red hair.
comments.subject: Re: cool. awesome.

What the flip?!?!?!?! I was NOT expecting that. I was so worked up I did not fall asleep until 2am list night/this morning!!! Thanks Mr. Martin!! The dark circles under my eyes are your fault!

All I can say is HOLY COW!!!!!!
